intro: Cyrtandra trionanthe, commonly known as the Hawaiian heliconia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, banana-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from yellow to red, and attract various pollinators. Cyrtandra trionanthe plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and supporting native insect populations.
